title: Aston Villa leave it late to see off dogged 10-man Brighton
text:
A stoppage-time goal by defender Matt Targett claimed three points for Villa after Brighton had battled manfully against the odds when a first-half red card for Aaron Mooy had obliged them to play for 55 minutes with 10 men.

A goal to the good when Mooy was dismissed, they were pegged back to 1-1 before half-time as Jack Grealish made up for a Villa goal disallowed following a VAR review just moments earlier.

Villa looked good to follow up their emphatic win at Norwich before the international break with another victory but Brighton organised themselves superbly and frustrated the home side until the last of four added minutes, when Grealish, who had covered more yards than anyone in trying to find a way through, found Targett with a smart ball on the left of the penalty area and the left-back beat Mat Ryan with a sharp finish.

Brighton had gone ahead after 21 minutes, defender Adam Webster heading home his first goal for the club as he met a free-kick from Pascal Gross at the far post. Conor Hourihane, in the thick of the action throughout, had given away the free-kick with a foul on Martin Montoya. He protested his innocence to no avail.
